title: Glanders and Farcy Act,1899
description: Official consolidated text of Glanders and Farcy Act,1899 (XIII of 1899) published by The Pakistan Code (General Laws).

provisions.title: Section 1. Short title and extent
provisions.content:
_ (1) This Act may be called the Glanders and Farcy Act, 1899.

[(2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan]; 2[*]
2

provisions.title: Section 2. Definition of “diseased”
provisions.content:
_(1) In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the
subject or context, “diseased” means affected with glanders or farcy or any other dangerous epidemic
disease among horses which the 3[Provincial Government] may, by 4notification in the 5[official
Gazette], specify in this behalf 6* * *.
(2) The provisions of this Act relating to horses shall apply also to 7[camels], asses and
mules.
8
[3. Application of Act to local areas by Provincial Government.___ (1) The 9[Provincial
Government] may, by notification10 in the 11[official Gazette], apply this Act or any provision of this
Act to any local area, to be specified in such notification, within the Province.
(2) In any such notification the 9[Provincial Government] may further direct that the Act or
any provision so applied shall apply in respect of–
(a)        all or any of the diseases mentioned or specified in a notification under section
2, sub-section (1),
(b)        all animals or any class of animals mentioned in section 2, sub-section (2).]

provisions.title: Section 4. Provincial Government to appoint Inspectors
provisions.content:
_ (1) When this Act has been so applied
to a local area, the 9[Provincial Government] may, by notification in the 11[official Gazette],
appoint12 such persons as it thinks fit to be Inspectors under this Act and to exercise and perform,
within the whole of the local area or such portions thereof as it may prescribe, the powers conferred
and the duties imposed by this Act on such officers.
(2) Every person so appointed shall be deemed to be a public servant within the meaning of
the Pakistan Penal Code (XLV of 1860).

provisions.title: Section 5. Power of entry and search. Within the local limits for which he is so appointed, any such
provisions.content:
Inspector as aforesaid may, subject to such rules as the l[Provincial Government] may make in this
behalf, enter and search any field, building or other place for the purpose of ascertaining whether
there is therein any horse which is diseased.

provisions.title: Section 6. Power of seizure. Within such limits as aforesaid, the Inspector may seize any horse
provisions.content: which he has reason to believe to be diseased.

provisions.title: Section 7. Horse to be examined by Veterinary Practitioner
provisions.content:
(1) On any such seizure as
aforesaid, the Inspector shall cause the horse seized to be examined as soon as possible by such
Veterinary Practitioner as the 1[Provincial Government] may appoint2 in this behalf:
Provided that, when the Inspector is also a Veterinary Practitioner so appointed, he may make
the examination himself.
(2) For the purposes of the examination, the Veterinary Practitioner may submit the horse to
any test or tests which the l[Provincial Government] may prescribe.

provisions.title: Section 8. Horse to be destroyed if found diseased: otherwise restored
provisions.content:
(1) If the Veterinary
Practitioner certifies in writing that the horse is diseased, the Inspector shall cause the same to be
immediately destroyed :
Provided that, in the case of any disease other than glanders or farcy, horses certified to be
diseased as aforesaid may, subject to any rules3 which the l[Provincial Government] may make in this
behalf, be either destroyed or otherwise treated or dealt with as the Veterinary Practitioner may deem
necessary.
(2) If, after completing the examination, the Veterinary Practitioner does not certify that the
horse is diseased, the Inspector shall at once deliver the same to the person entitled to the possession
thereof.

provisions.title: Section 9. When horse diseased, place where it has been to be disinfected, etc
provisions.content:
(1) When any
diseased horse has been in any building, shed or other enclosed place, or in any open lines, the
Inspector may issue a notice to the owner of the building, shed, place or lines, or to the person in
charge thereof, directing him to have the same disinfected and the internal fittings thereof, or such
other things found therein or near thereto as the l[Provincial Government] may by rule prescribe,
destroyed.
(2) On the failure or neglect of such owner or other person as aforesaid to comply with the
notice within a reasonable time, the Inspector shall cause the building, shed, place or lines to be
disinfected and the fittings or other things to be destroyed, and the expense (if any) thereby incurred
may be recovered from the owner or other person as if it were a fine.

provisions.title: Section 10. Owner or person incharge of diseased horse to give notice. The owner or any person in
provisions.content:
charge of a diseased horse shall give immediate information of the horse being diseased to the
Inspector or to such authority as the l[Provincial Government] may appoint2 in this behalf.

provisions.title: Section 11. Prohibition against removal, without license of horse which has been with diseased
provisions.content:
horse. No person in charge of any horse which has been in the same field, building or place as, or in
contact with, a diseased horse, shall remove such horse except in good faith for the purpose of
preventing infection, or under a license to be granted by the Inspector and subject to the conditions of
the license.

provisions.title: Section 12. Vexatious entries, searches and seizures
provisions.content:
_ (1) Whoever, being an Inspector appointed
under this Act, vexatiously and unnecessarily enters or searches any field, building or other place, or
seizes or detains any horse on the pretence that it is diseased, shall be punishable with imprisonment
for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or
with both.
(2) No prosecution under this section shall be instituted after the expiry of three months from
the date on which the offence has been committed.

provisions.title: Section 13. Penalty for refusing to comply with notice under section 9, or for removing horse
provisions.content:
contrary to section 11. Whoever refuses or neglects to comply with any notice issued by the
Inspector under section 9, or removes any horse in contravention of section 11, shall be punishable
with imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to
fifty rupees, or with both.

provisions.title: Section 14. Power to make rules
provisions.content:
(1) The 1[Provincial Government] may make rules3 to carry out
(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules as
aforesaid may___
(a)         regulate entries, searches and seizures by Inspectors under this Act;
(b)         regulate the use of test and the isolation of horses subjected thereto, and
provide for recovering the expense of detaining, isolating and testing horses
from the owners or persons in charge thereof as if it were a fine;
(c)          regulate the destruction or treatment, as the case may be, of horses certified
under section 8 to be diseased, and the disposal of the carcases of diseased
horses;
(d)         regulate the disinfecting of buildings and places in which diseased horses have
been, and prescribe what things found therein or near thereto shall be des-
troyed ; and
(e)         regulate the grant of licenses under section 11 and the conditions on which
those licenses shall be granted.

(3) All rules under this section shall be published in the l[official Gazette], and, on such
publication, shall have effect as if enacted by this Act.
(4) In making any rule under this section, the 2[Provincial Government] may direct that a
breach of it shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or
with fine which may extend to fifty rupees, or with both.

provisions.title: Section 15. Appointment of same person to be both Inspector and Veterinary Practitioner. Any
provisions.content:
Veterinary Practitioner may be appointed by the 2[Provincial Government] to be both Inspector and
Veterinary Practitioner for all or any of the purposes of this Act or of any rule thereunder.

provisions.title: Section 16. Protection to persons acting under Act. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding
provisions.content:
shall lie against any person for anything which is, in good faith, done or intended to be done under
this Act.
